texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: A few days ago, I stumbled upon a server running qmail with qmail-scanner. The server was throwing out this error when a user on the server attempted to send an e-mail to someone else:
texts.text: A few days ago, I stumbled upon a server running qmail with qmail-scanner. The server was throwing out this error when a user on the server attempted to send an e-mail to someone else:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The one thing I love about qmail is its extremely descriptive error messages. Did I say descriptive? I meant cryptic.
texts.text: The one thing I love about qmail is its extremely descriptive error messages. Did I say descriptive? I meant cryptic.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Luckily, clamdscan was a bit more chatty in the general system logs:
texts.text: Luckily, clamdscan was a bit more chatty in the general system logs:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: Nov 12 10:21:17 server X-Antivirus-MYDOMAIN-1.25-st-qms: server.somehost.com119488087677512190] clamdscan: corrupt or unknown clamd scanner error or memory/resource/perms problem - exit status 512/2
texts.text: Nov 12 10:21:17 server X-Antivirus-MYDOMAIN-1.25-st-qms: server.somehost.com119488087677512190] clamdscan: corrupt or unknown clamd scanner error or memory/resource/perms problem - exit status 512/2

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Okay, that helps a bit, but this one from /var/log/clamd.log was the big help:
texts.text: Okay, that helps a bit, but this one from /var/log/clamd.log was the big help:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: Mon Nov 12 12:20:29 2007 -> ERROR: Socket file /tmp/clamd.socket exists. Either remove it, or configure a different one.
texts.text: Mon Nov 12 12:20:29 2007 -> ERROR: Socket file /tmp/clamd.socket exists. Either remove it, or configure a different one.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I removed the /tmp/clamd.socket file and clamd began operating properly after a quick restart of the clamd service. This one was pretty easy, but it was not well documented (as I discovered from a little while of Google searching).
texts.text: I removed the /tmp/clamd.socket file and clamd began operating properly after a quick restart of the clamd service. This one was pretty easy, but it was not well documented (as I discovered from a little while of Google searching).
